title: Cultural tour of Rajasthan
text:
Travel Articles | October 9, 2015 
The cultural tours of Rajasthan offer an opportunity to get a glimpse of the exotic locales of the state along with the familiarization of unique Art & Craft, Music & Dance and delectable cuisines of Rajasthan. with various types of religions, music, dance, food, traditions, dialects and costumes. This Indian state has a very rich culture that attracts thousands of tourists towards it. This beautiful land of Maharaja's still has the essence of history, ethnicity and vibrancy from the medieval times. 
The ancient Indian life is reflected in the traditions (artistic and cultural) of Rajasthan. The state of Rajasthan is depicted by a rich and varied folk culture from small villages all over the area. 
The history of Rajasthan (also known as the land of Rajas) is glorious and is known for royalty and its interests in architecture. The area was also called Rajputana the country of the Rajputs, whose chivalry shaped social mores just as their often bitter and protected feuding dominated their day to day living. 
Rajasthan- the land of Royals, Drenched into grandeur and soaked into glorious history, the state of Rajasthan is one of the most captivating areas of India. The state is a famous tourist destination with lots of tourist attractions and fabulous tourist facilities; the level of standard is higher than other tourism hubs in India. Rajasthan attracts tourists and holiday seekers with its unique culture, ancient traditions, heritage and monuments. It is also rich in its flora and fauna with some of popular wildlife sanctuaries & national parks such as Bharatpur and Ranthambore. 
Classical music and dance with its own unique distinct style is a part of the cultural traditions of Rajasthan. The music is simple and lyrics depict day-to-day relationships and regular chores, more often focused around fetching water from nearby wells or ponds. 
The Ghoomar dance of Udaipur and the famous Kalbeliya dance from Jaisalmer have gained world-wide l recognition. Rajasthani Folk music is a vital part of its culture. Kathputali, Bhopa, Chang, Teratali, Ghindar, Kachchhighori, Tejaji, parth dance etc. are the examples of the culture depicting traditional Rajasthan. Ancient folk songs are common ballads which relate to charming heroic deeds and love stories from the area; devotional songs known as banis (often accompanied by musical instruments like, sitar, dholak and etc. are also sung. 
A carpet seller in Jaipur 
Rajasthan is famous for handicrafts, textiles and semi-precious stones, and for its traditional art. Rajasthani furniture has intricate carvings and bright fluorescent colors’. Block prints, tie and dye prints, Bagaru prints and Zari embroidery are major export products from the state of Rajasthan.
